data.title: Mozambique Considering TotalEnergies' Request to Increase LNG Project Costs, Bloomberg Says
data.description:
• Mozambique's President Daniel Chapo said his government is considering a proposal by France's TotalEnergies to alter the contract period and approve increased costs for its liquefied natural gas project, Bloomberg reports.
  • The French energy major is seeking a 10-year extension to the project--which has been delayed since 2021 due to security issues but is close to restarting--as well as a $4.5-billion increase in costs, according to Bloomberg.
  • "Mozambique may present counterarguments, and then we can reach a consensus on whether the proposed extension will proceed or not," Chapo said in translated comments, Bloomberg reports.

Full story: https://shorturl.at/hNU8q

Write to Adam Whittaker at adam.whittaker@wsj.com

data.title: Bavarian Nordic Gets New Procurement Framework Contract
data.description:
Bavarian Nordic A/S :

  • AWARDED NEW PROCUREMENT FRAMEWORK CONTRACT BY THE EUROPEAN COMMISSION TO STRENGTHEN PREPAREDNESS AGAINST SMALLPOX AND MPOX

  • AWARDED CONTRACT FOR UP TO 8 MILLION DOSES

  • 1.1 MILLION DOSES COMMITTED, FIRST 750,000 EXPECTED IN 2026

  • CONTRACT REPLACES PREVIOUS AGREEMENT AND PROVIDES FOR UP TO 8 MILLION DOSES OF SMALLPOX/MPOX VACCINE OVER NEXT FOUR YEARS

data.title: Austria Inflation Steady at 4% in October
data.description:
The annual inflation rate in Austria stood at 4% in October 2025, unchanged from the previous month. “Services resumed to have the greatest impact on inflation, rising by 4.6%, after 4,7% in September.

Inflation for industrial goods was also less pronounced at +1.3% compared to +1.4% in September.

Food, tobacco and alcohol showed a growth of 3.9%, following 3.8% in September.

The largest increase was in energy prices, which rose even more dynamically at +9.7% than in September with +8.1%, as prices increased for electricity and gas year-on-year.

The so-called core inflation, which covers the aggregates industrial goods and services, was 3.4%, down from 3.5% in September,” according to Statistics Austria Director General Manuela Lenk.

On a monthly basis, consumer prices rose by 0.4% in October, rebounding from a 0.2% fall in the preceding period.

data.title: Australia's Mining And Energy Union Says AGL Workers Warned Of Job Cuts Before Christmas
data.description:
Australia's Mining And Energy Union:

  • AGL POWER STATION WORKERS WARNED OF HUNDREDS OF JOB CUTS BEFORE CHRISTMAS

  • WORKERS AT AGL’S BAYSWATER AND LOY YANG A POWER STATIONS INFORMED OF RESTRUCTURE TO CUT HUNDREDS OF JOBS BEFORE CHRISTMAS

  • MEU WARNED GOVERNMENT INTERVENTION MAY BE NEEDED TO PREVENT AGL CUTTING JOBS EARLY TO AVOID TRANSITION SUPPORT OBLIGATIONS

  • REPRESENTATIVES WERE INFORMED THAT 300 JOBS WOULD BE CUT ACROSS AGL’S BUSINESS

data.title: IXIC: Nasdaq Plunges 1.6% as Rough Patch of Earnings Weighs on Tech Stocks
data.description:
Key points:
  • Tech stocks retreat broadly
  • Meta, Microsoft pull Nasdaq lower
  • Apple, Amazon will try to lift it up Friday

It was Microsoft and Meta which spooked investors out of risk assets.

📉 Tech Rout Sends Nasdaq Lower

  • The Nasdaq Composite tumbled 1.6% Thursday, dragged down by steep declines in Meta and Microsoft, which together erased hundreds of billions in market value after reporting some worrying figures.
  • The S&P 500 slipped 1%, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average, which carries less tech exposure, fell 0.2%, or about 110 points.
  • It was a bruising reminder that in a market dominated by mega-cap tech names, a few bad reactions can tip the entire index.

💸 Meta’s Spending Scare

  • Meta shares cratered 11.3%, their biggest one-day drop in over three years, after the company hiked its AI spending plans yet again — from $69 billion to $71 billion for 2025.
  • The move spooked investors who were already uneasy about rising costs across the tech landscape. Meta’s plan to raise at least $25 billion via a bond sale added to the concern.
  • Yields on Meta’s bonds jumped as traders questioned whether the company’s AI ambitions might start to squeeze profitability in the near term.

🖥️ Microsoft Joins the Selloff

  • Microsoft shares fell 2.9%, even after the company posted another earnings beat fueled by robust growth in its Azure cloud business.
  • The problem? The outlook. Microsoft’s own AI infrastructure spending outlook swelled, prompting worries that margin expansion could stall.
  • At the end of the day (pun intended) investors stayed optimistic ahead of Apple and Amazon’s earnings after the close. Both stocks popped after hours, with Apple up 3% and Amazon soaring 13% on solid results.

data.title: Strides Pharma Q2 Results: Stock jumps 13% on strong margin expansion; US guidance maintained
data.description:
Shares of Strides Pharma Ltd. surged to the day's high on Friday, October 31, in response to its September quarter results, that were better on a year-on-year basis. The stock surged as much as 13%, closing in on its 52-week highs of ₹972.

Net profit for the company went up by 82% from last year to ₹131.5 crore from ₹72.2 crore.

Revenue increased by 4.6% on a year-on-year basis to ₹1,221 crore. Earnings Before Interest, Tax, Depreciation and Amortisation (EBITDA) increased by 25.4% from the year-ago period to ₹232 crore.

EBITDA margin for the quarter expanded by over 300 basis points to 19% from 15.8% last year.

Shares of Strides Pharma are trading 11.6% higher after the earnings announcement at ₹950. The stock is up 35% so far on a year-to-date basis.

To be updated with more.
